drug.name: Bordetella pertussis toxoid antigen (formaldehyde, glutaraldehyde inactivated)
drug.description: Bordetella pertussis toxoid antigen (formaldehyde, glutaraldehyde inactivated) is a vaccine that is used in the prophylaxis of Pertussis (whooping cough), which is caused by a small Gram-negative coccobacillus that infects the mucosal layers of the human respiratory tract.

mixture.name: Boostrix
mixture.ingredients: Bordetella pertussis filamentous hemagglutinin antigen (formaldehyde inactivated) + Bordetella pertussis pertactin antigen (formaldehyde inactivated) + Bordetella pertussis toxoid antigen (formaldehyde, glutaraldehyde inactivated) + Clostridium tetani toxoid antigen (formaldehyde inactivated) + Corynebacterium diphtheriae toxoid antigen (formaldehyde inactivated)

mixture.name: Boostrix
mixture.ingredients: Bordetella pertussis filamentous hemagglutinin antigen (formaldehyde inactivated) + Bordetella pertussis pertactin antigen (formaldehyde inactivated) + Bordetella pertussis toxoid antigen (formaldehyde, glutaraldehyde inactivated) + Clostridium tetani toxoid antigen (formaldehyde inactivated) + Corynebacterium diphtheriae toxoid antigen (formaldehyde inactivated)

mixture.name: Infanrix
mixture.ingredients: Bordetella pertussis filamentous hemagglutinin antigen (formaldehyde inactivated) + Bordetella pertussis pertactin antigen (formaldehyde inactivated) + Bordetella pertussis toxoid antigen (formaldehyde, glutaraldehyde inactivated) + Clostridium tetani toxoid antigen (formaldehyde inactivated) + Corynebacterium diphtheriae toxoid antigen (formaldehyde inactivated)
